metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7795 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The manager_invoke_notify_message function in systemd 231 and earlier allows local users to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and PID 1 hang) via a zero-length message received over a notify socket.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu10
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu10
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu10
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu10
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu10
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu10
udev - 229-4ubuntu10
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> USN-3094-1 fix is incomplete, see bug sbeattie> additional DoS fix is covered by CVE-2016-7796, also upstream reworked fix for this CVE. trusty and vivid-phone are not affected as upstart is init there

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu10').
